name: Holiday Inn Ellesmere / Cheshire Oaks

reviews.text: Recently stayed for the second time in this hotel with my husband and two young sons. Its is clean and comfortable, breakfast is good and it is very handy for shopping in Cheshire Oaks. Only negative is that room service is very expensive for standard of food supplied.
reviews.title: Great for Cheshire Oaks

reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend at this hotel. Very clean and good sized room.
reviews.title: Good overall hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of staff welcoming and friendly but others need a little update in customer relations. The only thing that really spoiled the weekend was the evening meal on Saturday. We had booked on dinner b&b, friday evening meal was good but unfortunately saturday was serve yourself carvery. The food was basic, it cost the same as other evenings and we felt that it was defininitely not value for money.
reviews.title: Breakfast in Bed

likes.disliked: — Parking quite far away from Door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night to combine a trip to the cinema, pizza hut then shopping the next day.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

likes.disliked: — Hideous bedspread; car parking only just ample

reviews.title: Freindly Hotel. Fantastic value break.
reviews.text: Very clean room with nice veiws of the lock.

I booked this to meet up with my sister who lives in Exeter. (We had hoped to go to Chester but it was Race week so couldn't get booked in). I phoned to book and the receptionist told me how well located it was for shopping and told me various eating places nearby. They only had a double room with a sofa bed, but said she would see if she could swap us round. On arrival they had managed to get us two double beds which was perfect, and the view over the locks was lovely. We even got a complimentary bottle of wine! Not sure why & I did let reception know in case it had been put in the our room by mistake, but when I told them they said it we could have it anyway! We mentioned to housekeeping after first night that we found the pillows a bit hard, so she arranged 'squishy' pillows for us which were perfect. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The setting was lovely (although sunny weather probably helps!) and it was perfectly located for Cheshire Oaks, trains into Liverpool and Chester (although we didn't bother in the end we were having such a lovely chill out time). We only ate breakfasts at the hotel but they were freshly cooked and the tables were cleared straight away. The only thing we didn't realise was breakfast on Sunday was until 11am so we could have had an extra hour in bed! This trip was a birthday treat for us both, we always knoew we'd enjoy ourselves wherever we were, but the hotel exceeded our expectations - we had a fabulous time.
reviews.title: Great hotel in good location with lovely friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel. Brilliant staff. Great location. Would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the situation- it's hidden! Your sat nav will get you to the end of the street but the hotel is end-on to the approach road and over a bridge over the canal. Car parking is an issue- there are spaces for around 30 cars across the bridge - if they are taken you have a walk of maybe 200 yds across the canal.
reviews.title: Great hotel with minor niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception was excellent- wake-up calls, newspaper, restaurant booking and request for a comb all handled with great humour and efficiency. Staff were universally great but special mention for reception and restaurant staff.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The room is well planned- yes, it's very mass-produced but the desk is very usable, a comfy chair welcome and the bed just perfect. Noise levels were great on the 3rd floor. The bathroom was not so good. It smelled musty (shower curtain?) and the cleaning on the first day not great- a used towel left on the floor and drinking cup not replaced. The shower is over the bath and, whilst the shower curtain is heavy and does not wrap itself around you, the slippy bath is murderous. My wife fell and still carries the bruise 4 days later. The shower itself only carries 2 settings- 24 jets of wet needles or limp central mass. Poor.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, beautiful room will stay again

reviews.text: Check in was a breeze. We ate in the bar and was quite surprised with the food. It was actually quite nice - not the usual hotel food you get elsewhere! Bar staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Peaceful night overlooking the Canal Boat museum followed by an excellent breakfast. Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, food, staff. Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can get some really good rates depending when you stay making it excellent value for money.
reviews.title: So good we booked the wedding

reviews.text: My partner and I recently booked a stay at the Cheshire Oaks Holiday Inn in June of this year. We had read other reviews which helped us in making our decision to stay there. We were greeted with a friendly receptionist and checking in was quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean and very presentable, as was the bathroom, and there were plenty of towels for the two of us. I loved the shower, it was easy to get the temperature you wanted and at the power that you wanted.
reviews.title: Very pleasantly suprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel ticks all the boxes that you could want from a short stay in a UK hotel.
reviews.title: Much improved from previous visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As described in other reviews it is slightly difficult to find - you have to come off the motorway and then go back on, but just before you would enter the motorway itself you take a left which brings you round to the hotel. Alternatively you could come thorugh Ellesmere Port following signs for the boat museum.
reviews.title: A gem in Ellesmere Port

reviews.text: The hotel itself is great - perfectly functional for a short stay on the Wirral or of course a visit to the legendary Cheshire Oaks.
reviews.title: A great surprise - a hotel that shows genuine hostpitality

reviews.text: Rooms are standard size, clean and comfortable with tea/coffee facilties. You either look out over the locks and boat museum or accrosss the Mersey towards Liverpool depending which side you are on.
reviews.title: Excellent location & service - a rare combination!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool and gym are actually across from the hotel entrance in a separate building. Normal hotel sized pool, can be full of kids, no hot tub but the sauna was working fine and up to 100degC!
reviews.title: nice room, shame about leisure activities

aka: Holiday Inn Ellesmere / Cheshire Oaks Hotel
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Ellesmere Port/Cheshire Oaks, whether for leisure weekends in the Chester area or that business trip or conference to the North West. The hotel is delightfully situated on the tranquil and attractive Wirral peninsula near the historic river Mersey waterfront, adjacent to the award winning National Boat Museum, with immediate access to both historic City of Chester or across the River Mersey to Liverpool. Liverpool John Lennon Airport is only 30 minutes away, Manchester International Airport only 40 minutes away and with a P&O fast ferry service to Ireland available in Liverpool, the hotel is the most central position to explore the whole of the North West of England. All 83 luxuriously air conditioned bedrooms with HSIA connections have splendid views of the surrounding locks and canal waterways. Our Leisure club includes indoor swimming pool, sauna, sun shower and gymnasium. The hotel is near to Royal Liverpool Golf Cub, Chester Race Course, Blue Planet Aquarium, Cheshire Oaks Designer Outlet Village & Chester Zoo.
